reviews.sentence: Amazing Hospitality. You can not go wrong with the Taj Hospitality. Whilst the hotel is now old looks rusty needs renovation. its still a great place to live with some excellent helpful staff the food is amazing. The hotel seems to be renovating their rooms. depends which room one gets can be a bit noisy with the renovation work on. All in all a decent place to stay.
Timeless elegance of the 50s. The place is crying for refurbishment.

Renovation. Hotels needs more of maintenance and renovation in some parts seems to be looking more older overall good experience to stay at this property. Had fun with family and food was good. Garden to be maintained more as there is too much of greenery from all four sides of the property.

Great Hotel. Superb hotel amazing attention to detailand service from staff especially during breakfast. Well equipped gym and nice pool area. Our room was huge. The hotel is in need of a refurb as there are a few leaky roofs but it is still spectacular. Would definately stay again when in Chennai.

It just misses the mark. Clearly a good hotel in its day but it needs some maintenance on the tired areas to bring it back up to the top. Breakfast is good the chefs are eager to have a chat about it all and the pool is a little haven where you can forget the city outside. Rooms need an update especially the bathrooms. Raintre restaurant is a delight. Skip the Pan Asian though rubbish and over priced. Would go back.
Good. Staff attitude prompt and warm service. Hotel needs renovation.
Nice hotel with potential. Great service ambience but starting to show age. With some renovation can be restored back to former glory. Polite and helpful staff.

Conemara to Change. Within just 3 months we were back as a family to The Taj Conemara. This time we stayed here with mixed feelings of comfort knowing we can always expect a good standard of service food and general facilities and a tinge of sadness as this month end the curtains will fall on this superbly located and beautiful heritage property. we have been assured that this is for just an interval. The curtains are expected to rise within 2 years after a full refurbishment. we will wait with bated breath to see the Taj group present a new avatar. We said goodbye to their friendly staff who were all comfortable in the knowledge that they would be well taken care of by the Taj group in the interim and surely enjoyed a few good meals which the hotel is ensuring remains to good standard right up to the end of this scene. Thank you and best wishes for a grand reopening soon.

Lovely Stay. Had a long stay at the hotel with my wife. The staff was very courteous and helping. Took very good care of us managed our special requests and preferences. The hotel is undergoing renovation and hence the raintre and other restaurants were not functional. Rooms are nice and spacious. The hotel has the old world charm considering the fact that it is a heritage and 150 years old. The hotel is near the tourist attractions and popular eating joints.

Taj Conemera. One of the few heritage hotels located in the heart of the city. It is a mixture of old and new building currently undergoing renovation. Offers good food. Has ample parking space. A beautiful swimming pool to relax. Known for business meetings.

Nostalgia Revisited. I had last stayed or dined at Taj Conemara Chennai almost a decade back. I have always enjoyed staying there or dine at Raintre restaurant. So when I heard that after almost 2 years of renovation this iconic hotel of Chennai was re opening I decided to stay there when I visited Chennai recently. As I entered the hotel I was welcomed well by Ms Ankurita the duty manager at Taj Conemara. The check in was swift and efficient as they were expecting me. The entrance and the lobby are looking new contemporary efficient. The flower arrangement in the lobby was really nice. They upgraded me to the Colonial Room. The room is spacious with a very big private sit out overlooking the swimming pool. The room is done up tastefully retaining some old world charm yet contemporary. The amenities and facilities in the room are good too. I went around various parts of the renovated hotel and all seemed new. A few areas finishing touches were going on which I believe should be done in the next week to 10 days. Jiva Spa also should be functional in a weeks time. But overall the new look is nice. Raintre Restaurant The Verandah Restaurant are nice too. The live traditional performances at Raintre will also start in a weeks time. Overall a good visit to Taj Conemara reliving nostalgia. The staff is very friendly and eager to look after your needs. I am sure the new beginning of this iconic hotel will also be great.

Even after the renovations the warmth of the property is intact. Comfortable and charming stay as always. My partner had a little food poisoning and had to call housekeeping staff to clean the bathroom past midnight. It took some complaning on our part for the gentleman to clean it properly. Barring this incident we had a wonderful experience especially in Verandah restaurant and bar. The team is extremely attentive and pleasant.

Warm cozy familiar friendly. I stayed for 6 days and it was a warm friendly place. The staff smiled a lot and aimed to please. The hotel Public areas look pretty after renovation. Although the hotel has moved from Vivanta to Taj in branding it ’s not the same level as a Taj in Mumbai or Delhi. The rooms should have bathtubs. Leaking Taps a problem in hot water supply after 11 am and Airconditioning that could not be controlled from the room was surprising. It took three visits from engineers to reduce the temperature from. Standard 22 degrees in my room. The Food and Bev Service was excellent but the menu and overall quality of food was adequate. Housekeeping was efficient and prompt. The DJ for the new year eve party was terrible. The volume and quality of music the excessive strobes the darkness in the dessert section made me leave the party in 40 minutes. A stark difference from the Fishermans cove new year I attended last year which was classy. A special thank you to Micheal Vaishne Hena Bhaskar Shaji the restaurant manager at Raintre and the smart boy from Nainital who was in housekeeping. The gym is too rudimentary. The bar tenders are great but amazingly uncomfortable sofas in the bar.

Just Amazing. A visit to Chennai will never be complete without a Visit to the Taj. And this time the Taj Conemara was a Mandate one. With the Hotel going under a Renovation for some Quiet a Long Period it has taken all the Best Efforts to Being Back the Old Iconic Hotel to its Royal Beauty of Colonial History and Charm. The Rooms are spacious and comfortable and will give you a Perfect Feel of the Colonial Experience. Right from you enter the Hotel through the Red Carpet Since 1891 till you leave the Hotel back through the Red Carpet the sense of feeling which you get while being there can not be measured in any way. The Food over in the Veranda is quiet a Variety with lot of Innovative Dishes from the cuisines of the Nawabs and Anglo India Family with a lovely Breakfast Spread and to add on the gorgeous view of the Swimming Pool. The Lady Conemara gives you a Perfect reason to Relax the evening over a Sip of their Signature Cocktails in the Beautiful Library Lounge Inside. They also serve a kind off a Afternoon Tea which could not experience it but will give a hands on the next visit. In terms of their Foods Choises the Raintre Restaurant of theirs match all terms of Excellence. Last but not to forget the Heritage History Tour of the Hotel is Just a Wow Experience and is a Must Try without fail. It perfectly gives you the entire history behind the hotel and the fascinating facts which gives you a more of a Eagerness to stay in the Hotel. And the hotel is best resourced with the Well Trained Front Staff to take you on the tour. Definitely a Home away from Home. Never give a second thought of any other hotel in the city. It is definitely the Taj Conemara which you would be looking out for.

Enjoyable. Recently renovated. Great property that is peaceful in an otherwise chaotic city. Staff bent over backwards to assist wherever possible. Even though it is renovated they have tried to keep the old world charm. You will like this property if you are looking for old school elegance. Price point is also good.

A renovated Oasis. Newly refurbished with updated rooms great support facilities helpful and efficient staff. High speed Internet and great restaurants. Location is deal with transit time to key areas of short duration. Room service is fast and well served. The Hotel retains its reputation as an old styled institution with traditional charme.

You won me over. The team had a pre call to check on my arrival time. The check in was quick and the front end team was very efficient. However what WON ME OVER was the finer attention to details. The room that was readied for me had a Jahnamaz prominently kept. I have stayed at various hotels including some of the Taj properties. But this was a first time that someone had looked at such a closer look at the requirements of the guest. Needless to say I was able to use the same. The welcome personalized handwritten note from the GM Mr Ahmar Sidiqui shared the unique history of this renovated property. Mr. Michael at the front desk closed the stay with a smoother checkout. Thanks for making the stay memorable one.
memorable. Heritage Property beautifully refurbished. Very well maintained too. Bit confusing architecture.

Heritage and it definitely could be way better. 1. Wonderfully refurbished heritage hotel gives you a sense of pre independence era2. Good South Indian breakfast3. Well equipped Gym and Spa Rusty plumbing scratchy towels. Busy staff.

Typical Taj Conemara hospitality. I am a guest who have stayed close to 100 nights in Taj Conemara over the last decade both for my business and personal needs. This visit has been the first one after the make over of Conemara and i was extremely sad to note that the Typical Taj Conemara hospitality was absolutely missing. The place looks awesome and much better makeover than before but what made the experience look different is the people none had the personal touch and connect that a typical conemara had. The age old concept of conemara that i have known is To Remember and be remembered but did not see anything of that sort during this visit. I have always chosen conemara as my place to stay while at Chennai but after this visit probably would need to explore other options as well. Thanks to Conemara for bringing the pleasure and comfort on all our stays in the past.

Excellent Stay at Taj Conemara. The Overall Stay at Taj Conemara was Excellent. The Hotel is Renovated with lot of detailing to retain the charm of yesteryear in a blend of modern comfort. The welcome on Arrival was nice and room was neat and clean well appointed. Our Dinner at Rain Tree was great culinary experience the food was good as always. Met Chef Gokulakanan and he met us and explained the dishes Thanks. Buffet Breakfast on 25th was well spread and the service was efficient in spite the restaurant was packed.

Classy but room in need of renovation and cleaning. Very classy and colonial feel. Very nice setting of courtyard with garden and pool. It is possible to have breakfast outsideMaybe I was just unlucky and received the oldest cheapest room of the hotel. but when looking out the window of my room there were only ugly A C pipes on a very dirty and unkept balkony. The staff did not even care to clean cigarette butts and a water bottle with cigarettes directly in front of the window. see photoAlso the bathroom appliances are very old and spotty see photoSome areas of the room were quite dusty and could have been cleaned better.

Okay only. The hotel needs to work on Thier housekeeping badly. it is emabreasing for the housekeeping manager when u see rooms so dirty potty uncleaned properly and phones so loaded with dust and imneded as if it has never been cleaned. It was complete turn off. room service was super long if they are just they should Informo Order will be delayed we waited 1 hour then on top they forgot one item. When we ask for services like towels which are black and old and terrible or soaps they take forever and on top the sheets pillow and full of stench. While the heritage rooms are nice the bathrooms are super old and really need a revamp and training of housekeeping is a must.

Excellent. One of the nicest hotels I have stayed in. Recently redecorated heritage hotel with an interesting history. Very high standard of comfort and service. Lovely pool and friendly staff. Hard to beat. Food good and with European options if you have had enough spice. Very quiet despite central location. A top choice if you are staying in Chennai.

EXECELENT Stay in Taj conemara hotel. It is great experience being in taj hotel. Good maintanance food service everything is execelence up to the mark. Good interiors. Thanks to all the staff specially housekeping team 1 Vijay2 Sayani3 Pinbath.
